parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to official campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Mircea Geoană,  implicitly referring to him as a candidate. While it doesn't state his candidacy directly, the context of the post ("#AlegeriParlamentare") and the call to vote for PRA strongly implies this.  This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform.  The hashtags and the call to action ("vote for PRA") clearly indicate that it targets a wide audience, not just a specific individual. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support the Partidul România în Acțiune (PRA) in the parliamentary elections.  The mention of Mircea Geoană, coupled with the call to vote for PRA, directly aims to influence voting behavior. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic content. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected from journalistic reporting. Instead, it promotes a specific political party and candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not expressing a personal opinion; it's a clear call to action promoting a specific candidate and party in the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>482586644285428</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți, promotes the party and implicitly encourages voters to support Mircea Geoană in the parliamentary elections.  The post's content, targeting, and explicit call to action ("vote for PRA") strongly suggest it's electoral propaganda.  The post's timing (after the official campaign period) is a crucial factor.  While the post doesn't explicitly mention the end of the campaign period, the fact that it's a paid advertisement promoting a candidate during a period when such promotion might be restricted raises serious concerns.  The absence of a CMF number further weakens the argument that this is not electoral propaganda.  The reach of the post (50K-60K impressions, 100K-500K reach estimate) amplifies its potential impact.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Mircea Geoană</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PRA</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Partidul Rom\u00e2nia \u00een Ac\u021biune Mehedinți, prin postarea plătită cu ID-ul 482586644285428, difuzată pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, încalcă articolul 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin promovarea implicită a candidatului Mircea Geoană și a Partidului România în Acțiune (PRA) la alegerile parlamentare, după încheierea perioadei de campanie electorală.  Postarea, cu un buget de 1000-1500 RON, a generat 50.000-60.000 de impresii și o estimare a acoperirii de 100.000-500.000 de persoane, având un efect electoral clar prin îndemnul la vot pentru PRA.  Lipsa unui număr CMF întărește suspiciunea de încălcare a legii.  Contact: part9419@partidulromaniainactiunemehedinti.info, +40743302640, https://partidulromaniainactiunemehedinti.info/.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
